sections.heading: Overview
content:
Stuart Wolf Jr., MD, FACS, is assistant professor of surgery and director of
the Michigan Center for Minimally Invasive Urology at the University of
Michigan in Ann Arbor. He is also associate section head for informatics.

He was in the top 10 of his graduating class at Northwestern University
Medical School in Chicago. After serving residencies in surgery and urology at
the University of California in San Francisco, he completed a fellowship in
endourology at Washington University in St. Louis, Mo. He is certified by the
American Board of Urology.

In addition to providing review and editorial functions for major medical
journals in his several areas of interest, Wolf is active as a researcher. He
has been recognized numerous times by his peers for teaching excellence. He is
an active member of the Young Leadership Committee of the North Central Section
of the American Urological Association and is on the AUA Practice Parameters,
Guidelines, and Standards Committee. He was awarded a patent for 'Inhibition of
Urinary Calculi Growth'.
